text: Ronald Gene Simmons, Sr. (July 15, 1940 â€“ June 25, 1990) was an American spree killer, who killed 16 people over a week-long period that started December 28, 1987, by shooting and/or strangling, primarily in Russellville, Arkansas and all occurring in Arkansas. A retired military serviceman, Simmons murdered 14 members of his family, including a daughter he had sexually abused and the child he had fathered with her, a former co-worker, a stranger, and wounded four others. Simmons was sentenced to death 16 times on February 10, 1989, and after refusing to appeal his sentence, was executed by Arkansas in 1990. == References == Category:1940 births Category:1990 deaths Category:American people convicted of murder Category:American prisoners sentenced to death Category:American serial killers Category:American spree killers Category:Criminals from Chicago Category:Military people from Chicago
